Posts.Content: Oct 22, 2017 10:20AM Hmariac wrote: Thank you for the replies! Mystic88. I had BRACA test a few years ago with my gyn’s recommendation since I have a family history but it was negative. I have been steering clear of google since I know that could worry me more. I know that lumps are often benign but the worry creeps in. I’m waiting for my referral to go through so I’ll be calling the clinic again Monday to check that they’ve received it. My hubby in military so the referal process might be different. When my doctor does anyone know if it’s normal to be sent for An ultrasound and not a mammogram?
Posts.Title: 28 found Breast lump, worried. Hmariac mystic88

Posts.Content: Hmariac wrote: I'm 28 and a few weeks ago I noticed a breast lump the feels close to skin surface and seems to not move and is not painful. I went to my gyn for my normal well woman visit and she found the lump when she examined my breast, she told me she would refer me to radiology for a breast ultrasound. She didn't explain to me what she thought about it, she was just stoned faced and said get the ultrasound done. My mother had ovarian cancer, maternal grandmother and aunt had breast cancer, so finding a lump is starting to make me worry a bit. I have two young children and I worry if this lump is something significant will I get sick and they will not have my best self. Is there anyone who has been in this same boat that can offer their experience please? My husband is so terrified of the thought of this he doesn't want to talk about it. Is it notmal for doc to do ultrasound instead of mammogram? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 28 found Breast lump, worried. Hmariac mystic88
